Very fun game. It‚Äôs nice to play a game where you are the villain, because there aren‚Äôt many of those. Yes, there are some bugs, glitches, and annoying players, but it‚Äôs drastically reduced compared to many other popular games. It feels like the community is a lot more positive, even for such a violent game.

Dead by Daylight, a warning.
This is a great name in the asymmetrical genre, but before you buy, here are a few things to consider as a consumer:
1. This game has a steep learning curve, there are no skills from other games that transfer in a meaningful way. You will spend 5-20 hrs just to get a decent grasp on the main details of game play that will affect every game, though this can be mitigated somewhat by watching guides and or streamers.
2. Once you have a decent grasp on the game play, you will realize that obtaining the meta perk combinations is going to take two things:
- Time: to level each survivor/killer up to 40, at which point their perks can be learned on other characters (this is done with the in game currency gained through completed games)
- Money: you only start the game with a few survivors and killers to pick from, the rest of the roster is locked and can only be unlocked with actual money (Auric Cells, about $6ish per character) or iridescent shards (the passively gained currency, ~50-100hrs of game play to earn 1 character unlock)
3. There will be times when you are frustrated, not only with the disappointment of "losing", but also with the way the opposing team or killer treats you in the match or the endgame chat. Of course this is easy to ignore but if you let it get to you, you will not have a fun time.
4. This game, with all its oddities, is still very fun and quite addicting. If you do not have 15+ hrs per week to play I would almost say it isn't worth picking up. But weather you decide to commit time to this game or another, I'm sure it will be in your best interest. 

Here's to gaming, and actively making informed decisions with our time
All the best
- Your average DBD enjoyer

The game is great but I can't recommend it, specially if you plan to play killer, since this game is very unbalance to favor survivors, and I know it has to be this way, otherwise nobody will play survivor and the game will die BUT, this handicap in favor of survivors is TOO MUCH already, devs add even more resources for survivors like if they do not already have enough, for instance the new totems, now killers got another thing to worry about and micromanage, killers already had enough activities to do, moreover, survivors in this game are the most entitle and toxic creatures I ever met in my history of at least 20 years, I  gaming, I played Lol by the way, I advice you to turn of the chat.

To keep to simple: to defeat a decent team of survivors as a Killer, you will require to be at least good or better, a decent killer won't stand a chance vs a decent survivor team and so on, you will require way more skill and experience to defeat survivors with less skill and exp. And this can be easily proven watching the professional games, where killers only aspire to kill one survivor and they usually can't, and if they do it, they are praise for it, and I also know some people says that this does not matter because average players are not professional but you really have to be dumb to not realize is the same interaction but with higher skill, professional scenarios can be easily seen in lower levels, at least to some extent, Main survivors will never accept this of course

I honestly truly love this game and I have since launch on PlayStation but the MMR is so bad. I feel as if it's unfair to newer players to be paired up with experienced players, this results in newer killers camping and tunneling people because they feel like that's all they can do against an experienced survivor. Hit boxes are complete and utter ass, i feel like instead of making new chapters all the time, really listen to people who play the game and fix it. Other than this, the bugs in the game are no fun either. I can't tell if I should recommend this game to people or not to because I love the game but it's crap at the same time.

I hate this game, but I keep coming back.

While the idea is pretty cool, I spent 45 minutes in menus trying to get the game to connect to other player's lobbies.
As for the gameplay, once again the idea is fun, but it's incredibly hard for new players to get the hang of this, I did nog get a moments peace to try and get my bearings. As for a lot of gameplay elements, they are not explained at all, and other players  can get quite upset at you because they assume you know these little details.

I can't recommend it unless you are very competitive.
disbalanced space button

Graphics 6/10 (looks meh, a lot of the maps are dated)

Bugs  5/10 (Dont make me laugh, this game is infested with bugs, most are silly though)

Devs   4/10  (Dont care at all about the player base)

Solo    5/10  (Can be very frustrating playing survivor solo queue)

W/ Friends 9/10  (makes this game a joke and is actually very fun)

DLC  6/10   (If you want to stay meta, you have to cough up a decent amount of cash)

Playerbase   2/10  (Its a crapshoot, some games people are wholesome, others people are Chernynobl levels of toxic)


OVERALL VERDICT   6.9/10  (Good game to play with friends, honestly worth the time and money, especially if you like masochism and a deteriorating self-worth :). jokes aside, just dont be toxic and dont let toxic people bother you and you should enjoy the game a lot)
